com.datastax.oss.dsbulk.connectors.api

Interface Record

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ErrorRecord
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultErrorRecord, DefaultRecord

    public interface Record
    An item read by a Connector, or passed to a connector for writing. A record is composed of one or more fields.

    Records typically originate from a line in a file, or a row in a database table.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clear all fields in this record.
      Set<Field> fields()
      Returns a set containing all the fields in this record.
      Object getFieldValue(Field field)
      Returns the value associated with the given field.
      long getPosition()
      Returns the record's position inside its resource, typically the line number if the resource is a file, or the row number, if the resource is a database table.
      URI getResource()
      Returns the record's resource location, typically the file or database table where it was extracted from.
      Object getSource()
      Returns the record source, typically a line in a file or a row in a database table.
      Collection<Object> values()
      Returns a collection containing all the values in this record.

    • Method Detail

      • getSource

        @Nullable
Object getSource()
        Returns the record source, typically a line in a file or a row in a database table.
        Returns:
        The record source; may be null if the source cannot be determined or should not be retained.

      • getResource

        @NonNull
URI getResource()
        Returns the record's resource location, typically the file or database table where it was extracted from.

        Details about the returned URI, and in particular its scheme, are implementation-specific.

        Returns:
        The record's resource.

      • getPosition

        long getPosition()
        Returns the record's position inside its resource, typically the line number if the resource is a file, or the row number, if the resource is a database table.

        Note that in the case of a file, the record's position is not necessarily equal to the line number where it appears. First, if there is one or more header lines, the actual line number would be its position + the number of header lines. Moreover, it the resource contains multi-line records, then it is not possible to draw a direct relationship between the record's position and its line.

        Positions should be 1-based, i.e., the first record in the resource has position 1, and so on. If the position cannot be determined, this method should return -1.

        Returns:
        the record's position, or -1 if the position cannot be determined.

      • fields

        @NonNull
Set<Field> fields()
        Returns a set containing all the fields in this record.
        Returns:
        a set containing all the fields in this record.

      • values

        @NonNull
Collection<Object> values()
        Returns a collection containing all the values in this record.

        The iteration order of this collection should match that of fields().

        Returns:
        a collection containing all the values in this record.

      • getFieldValue

        @Nullable
Object getFieldValue(@NonNull
                               Field field)
        Returns the value associated with the given field.

        Note that a return value of null may indicate that the record contains no such field, or that the field value was null.

        Parameters:
        field - the field.
        Returns:
        the value associated with the given field.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear all fields in this record.

        This method should be used to free memory, when this record's fields have been successfully processed and are no longer required.
